intro: Viguiera pachycephala, commonly known as the Mexican heath, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. Viguiera pachycephala is also known for its resilience and ability to withstand drought conditions.
